node.text: Welcome to the new era of Martian exploration! Yesterday the world looked on in awe as NASA shared the first video of a rover landing on another planet and the first recording of audio from Mars. Listen to our CEO @billnye as he reacts to this unprecedented moment in history.

node.title: Bill Nye on the Perseverance Landing

node.text:
115 members traveled to Washington D.C. from 28 states for one massively successful day of action to #FundSpace
•
Will you join us next year? Get involved at planetary.org/advocacy
•
*Note: this event took place over a month ago. We share it today to thank our members for their hard work. •
The Planetary Society moved quickly last week to cancel all in-person meetings, business travel, and become a remote workplace to help #flattenthecurve. Stay healthy, everyone!

node.text: It isn’t easy to defend our planet from asteroids. That’s why we support those who step up to the job.

Star Trek: Voyager's holographic doctor, Robert Picardo, also serves on The Planetary Society Board of Directors. However, he is not the first connection between Star Trek and The Planetary Society. In 1980, the creator of Star Trek, Gene Roddenberry, wrote a letter and sent it out to a Star Trek fans mailing list. In the letter, Gene invited his fans to join us on our mission to explore the cosmos.

Hear the letter as read by Robert Picardo, listen to his Jean-Luc Picard impression, and see inside Bill Nye's office for more Star Trek artifacts on hand at The Planetary Society.

Read the full letter at planetary.org

node.title: A rare letter from Star Trek creator Gene Roddenberry

node.text: We can now sail on sunlight in space, just like a sailboat at sea! Our CEO @BillNye explains how.

node.title: Bill Nye explains: A new way to travel space

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on September 10, 2021. May be an image of sky.

node.text:
True story: Space advocates saved the Hubble Space Telescope.

In 2004, @nasa announced that the final servicing mission to @nasahubble was canceled. Planetary Society members and space fans around the world sent letters to the US Congress to advocate for the beloved telescope, and it worked! 🎉

How have Hubble images impacted you?

This image of the Orion Nebula was created using data from the Hubble and Spitzer Space Telescopes. The second image shows NASA astronauts servicing Hubble in 2009.

(📸 1: NASA/JPL-Caltech/STScI 2: NASA)

#space #hubble #NASA

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on September 10, 2021. May be an image of sky.
Photo by The Planetary Society on September 10, 2021. May be an image of indoor and outdoors.
Photo by The Planetary Society on September 09, 2021. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text:
Second Martian rock sample achieved!

NASA's Perseverance rover successfully processed and stored another rock core for later study on Earth. That's the second Martian sample collected this week (or ever). Quite an accomplishment!

These images taken by Perseverance show the holes made in the rock during sampling and the new rock core inside the sample tube.

What do you hope we will learn from these samples?

(📸 : NASA/JPL-Caltech/ASU/MSSS)

#Mars #rock #NASA

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on September 09, 2021. May be an image of outdoors.
Photo by The Planetary Society on September 09, 2021. May be a closeup.
Photo by The Planetary Society on September 09, 2021. May be an image of 4 people, people standing, outdoors and text that says 'INSPIRATIAN INSP ATION'.

node.text:
Get ready for the first-ever entirely civilian mission to Earth orbit, Inspiration4! 

Next week, @SpaceX's Inspiration4 mission will carry a four-person crew into orbit for three days before splashing back down. The mission hopes to raise $200 million in donations for @stjude Children's Research Hospital, which focuses on treating cancer and pediatric diseases.

This image shows the Inspiration4 crew during jet training in Bozeman, Montana.

Have you ever wanted to go to space?

(📸 : Inspiration4 / John Kraus)

#space #inspiration #

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on September 07, 2021. May be an image of indoor.

node.text:
NASA's James Webb Space Telescope is set to revolutionize our understanding of the cosmos, and we can't wait for its launch!

Galileo made history with a tiny telescope. Just imagine what we can do with an infrared space telescope 100 times more powerful than Hubble.

You can learn all about JWST in the newest issue of our magazine, The Planetary Report. (Link in bio.)

How do you think Galileo would react to JWST?

(📸 : NASA)

#space #telescope #NASA

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on September 04, 2021.

node.text:
Are you ready for the season to change? If you lived on Mars, you’d have to wait a bit longer. With a longer orbit around the Sun, the four seasons on Mars each last more than twice as long as they do on Earth. On Neptune, each season lasts 40 years.

This image of Mars was taken by @ESA's Mars Express spacecraft on Feb. 13, 2016.

(📸 : ESA/DLR/FU Berlin/J. Cowart)

#Mars #space #seasons

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on September 03, 2021.

node.text:
Success! NASA's Perseverance rover collected its first Martian rock sample!

What should the mission team do to celebrate? 🥳 🎉

This image from Perseverance's Mastcam-Z shows the Mars rock inside the sample tube. 

(📸 : NASA/JPL-Caltech/ASU/MSSS)

#Mars #rocks #space

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on September 02, 2021. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text:
Perseverance Martian rock sampling: Take 2!

@NASA's Perseverance rover drilled into its new rock target. Now the team needs to analyze the images and data to confirm whether the rock core stayed intact and made it into the sample collection tube.

Have you ever collected a sample for study before?

(📸 : NASA/JPL-Caltech)

#NASA #Mars #rocks

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on September 01, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, people standing and wrist watch.

node.text:
We have a long tradition of sending messages from Earth, including people's names, to space. Since 1996, we've sent a member roster to space aboard 19 different spacecraft, including New Horizons, the Mars rovers Spirit and Opportunity, and LightSail 2. 

A miniature DVD containing images of space fans and names of Planetary Society members and supporters is currently orbiting the Earth aboard our LightSail 2 spacecraft. This image shows Bruce Betts, our director of science and technology, handing off the mini-DVD containing names and images from Planetary Society members to Riki Munakata, the LightSail 2 project integration lead for Ecliptic Enterprises Corporation.

Has your name been to space before?

#space #science

node.text:
NASA's Perseverance rover is getting ready to make a second attempt at collecting a sample on Mars. Wish the team luck!

Perseverance uses a drill to extract core samples. The drill has two modes: rotary (drill bit under constant pressure) and percussive (drilling supplemented by hammerlike blows). The rover is designed to collect samples that are about 13 millimeters (0.5 inches) in diameter and about 60 millimeters (2.4 inches) long.

(Vid: NASA/JPL-Caltech)

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on September 01, 2021. May be a closeup.

node.text:
Beautiful!

The @europeanspaceagency's Mars Express orbiter captured this view of Mars' southern polar ice cap. This enhanced image was created from infrared, green, and blue-light images taken by the spacecraft.

Mars' polar ice caps are made mostly of water ice. 

What's your favorite feature on Mars?

(📸 : ESA/G. Neukum (Freie Universitaet, Berlin)/Bill Dunford/Edited by The Planetary Society)

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on August 31, 2021.

node.text:
LightSail 2 is still in orbit around the Earth and taking beautiful images of our planet.

This image taken by our LightSail 2 spacecraft on April 11, 2021 shows Sri Lanka and the southern tip of India.

Have you spotted your country in one of our LightSail 2 photos before?

#space #Earth #science

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Planetary Society on August 30, 2021. May be a closeup of outdoors.

node.text:
NASA's Perseverance rover is on the hunt for a new rock to sample on Mars. 

Perseverance is now studying this rock, called "Rochette." The rover ground the outer surface off of the rock to see what lies underneath and determine if it is a good site for a second try.

Perseverance's first sampling was foiled when the target rock crumbled, but the mission team learned a lot from the attempt.

Perseverance captured this image on Aug. 27, 2021.

What would you say to encourage Perseverance?

(📸 : NASA/JPL-Caltech)

#space #NASA #science
